definition: A sequence of events or actions that occur one after another, often with a cause-and-effect relationship. It is commonly used to describe the consecutive episodes of a television or radio series, as well as the subsequent outcomes or consequences of a particular event or decision.

examples.german: Die erste Folge der Serie war sehr spannend.
examples.english: The first episode of the series was very exciting.

examples.german: Er hat die Anweisungen in der richtigen Folge befolgt.
examples.english: He followed the instructions in the correct sequence.

examples.german: Die Folgen des Unfalls waren schwerwiegend.
examples.english: The consequences of the accident were serious.

examples.german: Ich habe die letzte Folge der Sendung verpasst.
examples.english: I missed the last episode of the show.

examples.german: Die Folge des Streits war eine langj√§hrige Feindschaft.
examples.english: The result of the argument was a long-lasting enmity.
